dream.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a series of thoughts, images, and feelings that you experience when you are asleep
dream.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: I had lots of dreams last night.
In my dream I flew to a forest of enormous trees.
dream.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a wish to do, be, or have something – used especially when this seems unlikely
dream.translation[0].definitions[1].note: beyond your wildest dreams (=better than anything you imagined or hoped for)
dream.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Her dream is to make a movie.
I have just met the man of my dreams (=the perfect man)!
I fulfilled a childhood dream when I became champion.
dream.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1: a series of thoughts, images, and feelings that you experience when you are asleep
dream.translation[0].note_box[0].section: I had a dream about you last night.
The movie gave the kids bad dreams.
Sometimes I have a strange dream in which I try to speak but I can’t.
In a vivid dream he saw a huge coloured bird flying above his head.
Having recurrent dreams is a very common experience.
That summer was so wonderful it seemed like a dream.
dream.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 2: a wish to do, be, or have something – used especially when this seems unlikely
dream.translation[0].note_box[1].section: have a dream/dreams
I had dreams of becoming a doctor.
achieve/fulfil/realize a dream
He had finally achieved his dream of winning an Olympic gold medal.
pursue/follow a dream
She left her home town to pursue her dreams.
dream a dream
We can dream great dreams for ourselves and others.
ADJECTIVES/NOUN + dream
big/great dreams
She was a little girl with big dreams.
an impossible dream
Having a number one record had seemed an impossible dream.
a childhood dream
I had a childhood dream of becoming an astronaut.
a lifelong dream
His lifelong dream had been to write a novel.
a distant dream
Peace in this area may still be a distant dream.
a dream comes true
I’d always wanted to go to Africa and at last my dream came true.
the man/woman/house etc of your dreams
We can help you find the house of your dreams.
not/never in your wildest dreams
Never in my wildest dreams did I think I would win the competition.
beyond your wildest dreams
Suddenly he was wealthy beyond his wildest dreams.
dream.translation[0].note_box[2].section: when you are sleeping
dream
the thoughts, images, and feelings that go through your mind while you are asleep
I had a strange dream last night -- you and I were in some sort of forest.
nightmare
a very unpleasant and frightening dream
She still has terrible nightmares about the accident.
daydream
a series of pleasant thoughts that go through your mind when you are awake, so that you do not notice what is happening around you
Neil was in a daydream, and didn’t hear the teacher call his name.
reverie
a state of imagining or thinking about pleasant things, that is like dreaming
The doorbell rang, shaking her from her reverie.
something that you want to do
dream
something very special that you want to do and that you think about a lot, especially something that is not very likely to happen
As a teenager, his dream was to become a professional footballer.
ambition
something that you want to achieve and that you work hard to achieve, especially in your work
My ambition had always been to start my own business.
aspirations
the important things that people want from their lives – used especially about the things a society or a large group of people wants
It’s important that young people think seriously about their career aspirations.
fantasy
something exciting that you imagine happening to you, which is extremely unlikely to happen and often involves sex
schoolboy fantasies
pipe dream
a dream that is impossible or is extremely unlikely to happen
Is world peace no more than a pipe dream?
dream.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to think about something that you would like to happen or have
dream.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: She dreamed of becoming a chef.
He’s got the sort of money that you and I can only dream about.
She dreamed that one day she would be famous.
dream.translation[1].definitions[0].note: I’ve always dreamed of being an artist
I’ve always dreamed to be an artist
dream.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to have a dream while you are asleep
dream.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: I dreamt about you last night.
It’s quite common to dream that you’re falling.
dream.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to think about something else and not give your attention to what is happening around you
dream.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: She had been dreaming and had not followed the conversation.
dream.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: to imagine that you have done, seen, or heard something that you have not
dream.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: I was sure I posted the letter but I must have dreamt it.
